ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Basically, this is a survey of classic and recent texts in the history of New World slavery before 1800 or so. Because the subject is so important, I would recommend this course to any Americanist.

I would, and have, recommended History 717 to other students. I did so primarily because of the professors, actually. I don't think I've felt that comfortable in a seminar here at Yale, and as I wrote above, many of the discussions were extremely engaging.

I would wholeheartedly recommend History 717 01 to another student: It gives a state of the art-overview in American slavery, engages critically with the central questions in the field, and points to potential paths of future research.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I came to this class with little knowledge about slavery before 1800, and even less about the institution outside of the United States. So this class gave me a deeper and broader grasp of this subject.

This course touched upon several of the themes that I will encounter in my field and in my dissertation research. However, its greatest merit was that it introduced me to a much broader corpus of literature than I would otherwise have read.
